channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Call Issued for Projects Related to HPC-Quantum Workflow
item.description: To continue RPI’s and IBM’s collaborative HPC-Quantum integration efforts, proposals are being sought for projects with potential applications and use cases for the upcoming HPC-Quantum workflow. RPI’s Future of Computing Institute will hold a 9AM-noon workshop on July 24 in CII 3130; you may also attend via Webex. If you wish to present a project or have questions, contact Osama Raisuddin.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Leaders in Action” Conversation to be Held with Trustee and CDPHP CEO Dr. John Bennett
item.description: Date: Monday, July 29, 2024 4:00 PM - 6:00 PM - During this session, hosted by Prof. Azita Hirsa, Trustee John D. Bennett, MD, FACC, FACP, immediate past President and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Capital District Physicians’ Health Plan, Inc. (CDPHP®), will discuss the principles of authentic leadership and what it means to embody this practice. Participants will have the opportunity to ask questions related to the topic. Refreshments will be served following the session.
item.author: Community

item.title: DotCIO Schedules License Server Maintenance for Evenings of July 22-23
item.description: From 5:30PM to 8PM ET on Monday and Tuesday, July 22 and 23, DotCIO staff will be performing maintenance on the license servers used for software activation on campus. License servers will be restarted during this time, so those who use the software that utilizes these license servers may temporarily experience license activation issues.
item.author: Community

item.title: Computer Science Alumni Career Panel Scheduled for July 24
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 24, 2024 7:00 PM - 8:00 PM - Students are invited to join this career panel, hosted by the School of Science Hub via WebEx. A fantastic opportunity to gain insights from distinguished alumni who have paved their way in various prominent tech companies, the event will cover topics such as career paths, industry insights, and tips for navigating the tech world.
item.author: Students

item.title: Summer Outdoor Program Series Continues with Day Hike at Moxham Mountain
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 31, 2024 8:00 AM - 3:00 PM - Students are invited to join this daytime hiking trip on Moxham Mountain, located near the town of Minerva, New York! The trip, which is approximately five miles round-trip and should take about three hours, is limited to ten participants and registration is required; please look for information and registration on the Muller Center’s Instagram page, or contact Will Weinert if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: Tickets for Angélique Kidjo with Philadelphia Orchestra Now Available
item.description: Date: Friday, August 2, 2024 7:30 PM - Following her 2023 Saratoga Jazz Festival debut, five-time GRAMMY® award winner and African music icon Angélique Kidjo joins The Philadelphia Orchestra in an all-new program featuring a mix of popular African songs and original works. Limited free tickets and transportation to SPAC will be available to students at the Union Administration Office beginning Monday, July 22.
item.author: Students

item.title: Lally, NYSTEC Offering Day Trip to Griffiss Business and Technology Park
item.description: On Wednesday, July 24, students from all schools and majors are invited to attend a field trip to the Griffiss Business & Technology Park in Rome, NY. The trip will depart from the RPI Union loop at 8:00am and return to RPI by 4:30pm. Space is limited to 25 students, so visit the Handshake event page for full details and to register; email Dr. Kevin Fletcher with any dietary restrictions.
